text: Oncogenicity of human papillomavirus - or adenovirus-transformed cells correlates with resistance to lysis by natural killer cells .

The reasons for the dissimilar oncogenicities of human adenoviruses and human papillomaviruses ( HPV ) in humans are unknown but may relate to differences in the capacities of the <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> E7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins to target cells for rejection by the host natural killer ( NK ) cell response .

As one test of this hypothesis , we compared the abilities of <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> E7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing human fibroblastic or keratinocyte - derived human cells to be selectively killed by either unstimulated or interferon ( IFN ) - activated NK cells .

Cells expressing the <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncoprotein were selectively killed by unstimulated NK cells , while the same parental cells but expressing the HPV type 16 ( HPV-16 ) or HPV-18 <extra_id_0> E7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncoprotein were resistant to NK cell lysis .

The ability of IFN - activated NK cells to selectively kill virally transformed cells depends on IFN 's ability to induce resistance to NK cell lysis in normal ( i.e . , non-viral oncogene - expressing ) but not virally transformed cells .
<extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocked IFN 's induction of cytolytic resistance , resulting in the selective lysis of adenovirus-transformed cells by IFN - activated NK cells .

The extent of IFN - induced NK cell killing of <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing cells was proportional to the level of <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and correlated with the ability of <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to block IFN - stimulated gene expression in target cells .

In contrast , <extra_id_0> E7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocked neither IFN - stimulated gene expression nor IFN 's induction of cytolytic resistance , thereby precluding the selective lysis of HPV-transformed cells by IFN - activated NK cells .

In conclusion , <extra_id_0> E1A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression marks cells for destruction by the host NK cell response , whereas the <extra_id_0> E7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncoprotein lacks this activity .
